Description:
This web service retrieves high-level infection information from a patient's chart. An infection might be a laboratory-confirmed infection or colonization, such as influenza or methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, or a placeholder for a suspected infection, such as respiratory rule-out or suspected COVID-19.

Like the Condition (Infection) web service, this web service evaluates infection (INF) records, but it returns only a brief overview of key information about those records, such as whether they are active and when they were resolved. If you need to return more detailed information, use the Condition (Infection) web service instead.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Reference to a Patient resource the Flag is for.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must match.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the infection: active or inactive.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to a Patient resource the Flag is for.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must match.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

Flag.Name: Flag
Flag.Description: A single instance of a Flag resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description: The Epic category ID for the infection, labeled “infection,” and the LOINC code for the infection, labeled “condition.”

code.Name: code
code.Description: The diagnosis code for the infection.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: A reference to the Encounter resource. Used only for encounter-level infections.

flag-detail.Name: extension
flag-detail.Description: A reference to the Condition (Infection) resource.

profile.Name: profile
profile.Description: Available in Netherlands environments only. This environment shows that this API conforms to the profile connected to the following canonical url: http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-Alert

period.Name: period
period.Description: The period during which the infection was marked as active.

end.Name: end
end.Description: Date when the infection was marked as resolved.

start.Name: start
start.Description: Date when the infection was added.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the infection: active or inactive.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: A reference to the Patient resource.
